intro: Galium album var. petraeum, commonly known as white bedstraw or rock bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or shaded environments, such as cliffs, screes, and woodland edges. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils.
